title: Single Responsibility Principle
instructions:
Apply SRP: A class should have only one reason to change.

Problem: Refactor this violation of SRP.

The bad code has a UserManager class that:
- Manages user data
- Validates emails
- Sends emails
- Generates reports

Your task: Split this into focused classes.

1. Create an EmailValidator class:
   - isValid(email: string): boolean
   - Validates email format (contains @ and .)

2. Create an EmailService class:
   - send(to: string, subject: string, body: string): void
   - Logs 'Sending email to {to}: {subject}'

3. Create a UserRepository class:
   - private users: User[] = []
   - add(user: User): void
   - findByEmail(email: string): User | undefined
   - getAll(): User[]

4. Create a UserReportGenerator class:
   - generate(users: User[]): string
   - Returns formatted report string

5. Create User interface: { id: number, name: string, email: string }

Key insight: Each class now has a single responsibility and one reason to change.
